net.sf.appia.core
Class Channel

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.appia.core.Channel

public class Channel
extends java.lang.Object

A Channel is an instance of a QoS.
It is composed of a stack of Sessions, and it offers Events and other functionality.
It also serves as access to other Appia functionality.

Version:
0.1.1
Author:
Alexandre Pinto Modified by Bruno Simoes & Fernando Vicente & Paulo Sousa (5/2001) Modifications: on getEventRoute(Event e): before: only the event received was searched on the hashtable now: the event received and all its superclasses are searched on the hashtable
See Also:
QoS

public int getFirstSession(ChannelEventRoute channelRoute,
                           int dir,
                           Session source)
                    throws AppiaEventException

Parameters:
channelRoute - the route of the Event
dir - the direction the Event will take
source - the Session from where the Event will come

the index of the first Session in terms of the Sessions stack
Throws:
AppiaEventException - with one possible type: UNKNOWNSESSION

Parameters:

Returns:
are the two QoSs equal

start

public void start()
           throws AppiaDuplicatedSessionsException
Starts, initializes, a Channel.
First, it allows all already set Sessions to set yet unbounded Sessions in the Channel stack.
Second, it sets all yet unbounded Sessions with a default Session.
Third, it checks to see if some Session appears twice in the stack.
Fourth, it generates all the ChannelEventRoutes using as starting point the QoSEventRoutes of the corresponding QoS.
Fifth, it registers the given EventScheduler with Appia
Sixth, and finally, it sends the ChannelInit

Throws:
AppiaDuplicatedSessionsException - if a Session appears twice in the Channel stack

isStarted

public boolean isStarted()

end

public void end()
Ends Channel operation.
It sends the ChannelClose.

getCursor

public ChannelCursor getCursor()
Get a ChannelCursor for the current Channel Sessions stack.

Returns:
a ChannelCursor for the stack

insertEvent

protected void insertEvent(Event event)
                    throws AppiaEventException
Inserts an Event in the Channel.
It cheks if the Channel is close and calls EventScheduler.insert(Event).

Throws:
AppiaEventException - as the possible result of calling EventScheduler.insert(Event) or with type CLOSEDCHANNEL if the Channel is closed

handle

public void handle(Event event)
Method that handles all channel events when they reach the top or the bottom of the Sessions stack.
If the Event is a Timer or PeriodicTimer event it forwards the Event to the TimerManager.
If the Event is a EchoEvent it gets the payload Event, inverts the direction and sends that Event.

getJMXConfiguration

public JMXConfiguration getJMXConfiguration()
Gets the JMX configuration.

Returns:
Returns the JMX configuration.
